results.title: Coyote ugly [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Jerry Bruckheimer Films, Jerry Bruckheimer, Chad Oman and David McNally
results.brief_description: Innocent New York newcomer Violet Sandford (Piper Perabo) needs a job to support herself while waiting for her big break as a songwriter, and hears about a nightly well paying position as a barmaid in a popular bar. ‘Coyote Ugly’ is run by Lil, a fast talking determined woman trying to succeed in a male dominated world. Her staff of beautiful women including tough Rachel and sweet Cammie, nightly pour drinks and entertain the bars mainly male clientele. In a world unlike the one she left behind, Violet struggles to keep her head above water, by day peddling her songs to anyone willing to listen, by night dancing on a bar as a ‘Coyote’, and in between developing her relationship with Kevin (Australian Adam Garcia). Cast includes John Goodman, Melanie Lynskey and model Tyra Banks.

results.title: Cover girl
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Arthur Schwartz and Charles Vidor
results.brief_description: A chorus girl is given a chance for stardom when she is befriended by a wealthy magazine editor who used to be in love with her mother. She is torn betweeen loyalty and the secret love she has for the nightclub manager where she works, and leaving for the bright lights and fortune that will await her as a cover girl. She is faced with a difficult choice between love and fame, or can she have both? Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly who play the star crossed lovers are well supported by Phil Silvers and Eve Arden. (Awards: Jerome Kern and Ira Gershwin for Best Musical Score)

results.title: Countdown
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Seven Arts Productions, William Conrad and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: The space-race between the United States and the Soviet Union reaches new heights when the Russians employ plans to send cosmonaughts directly to the moon. In the desperate attempt to be first, NASA sends Lee (James Caan) in an old style Gemini probe on a make-shift mission after three weeks training: to land on the Moon, and then live there for a year until rescued by the Apollo crew. This wry absurdity, directed by Altman after a ten year absence from filmmaking, makes great viewing for it depicts the US government as the “bad guy” and contains several anti-Cold War gestures. Screenplay by Loring Mandel. Based on the book, “Countdown” by Hank Searl.

results.title: Cosi
results.creator_credit: Smiley Film, Meridian Films, Richard Brennan, Timothy White and Mark Joffe
results.brief_description: Lewis (Ben Mendelsohn) is a uni drop-out who takes a last-ditch job in an asylum working with patients who are interested in the dramatic arts. He thinks his work will involve staging a small variety show with the group, until long-term patient, Roy, insists that the production be nothing less than a grand staging of Mozart’s opera Cosi Fan Tutte. It’s an ambitious thought to say the least. After all, none of the patients can speak Italian nor sing and the cast is made up of aging nymphomaniacs, obsessives and pyromaniacs who really have other things on their minds. Funny, warm and wonderfully mad, this is one production that’s definitely all there, even if the cast isn’t.

results.title: Copycat
results.creator_credit: Regency Enterprises, Joseph Caracciolo Jr, John Fiedler, Arnon Milchan, Michael Nathanson, Mark Tarlov and Jon Amiel
results.brief_description: A murderer is on the loose in San Francisco, constantly staying one step ahead of the police. Criminal psychologist and noted author Helen Hudson (Signourney Weaver) notices the killer’s pattern. He is a copycat and is imitating the serial killers in one of Helen’s novels. She reports this to the police and assists Homicide detective Monahan (Holly Hunter) in the investigation, depsite being agoraphobic and unable to leave home. As their investigation gets closer the catching the killer, they realise his real target is Helen and she must fight to stay alive.

results.title: Cop land
results.creator_credit: Woods Entertainment, Miramax Films, Gary Woods, Cathy Konrad, Ezra Swerdlow and James Mangold
results.brief_description: Freddy Heflin is a simple, small-town sheriff whose life is about to change. After he uncovers evidence of murder, faked suicide and police tampering, Freddy must choose between the man he idolizes, the woman he adores and the law he’s sworn to defend. Cast includes Sylvester Stallone, Harvey Keitel, Ray Liotta, Robert de Niro.

results.title: Cool runnings
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Dawn Steel and Jon Turteltaub
results.brief_description: The world was shocked when Jamaica entered the Winter Olympics with a bobsled team. Although they don’t win gold, the four Jamaicans become heroes for their courage and determination to compete with the world’s best. John Candy plays the ex-Olympian, once accused of cheating, who acts as their coach. Based on a true story “Cool Runnings” repeats the ageless Disney film message about following your dreams.

results.title: Cool hand Luke
results.creator_credit: Jalem Productions, Warner Bros Pictures, Gordon Carroll and Stuart Rosenberg
results.brief_description: Paul Newman stars as “Cool Hand Luke”, the irreverent loner, sentenced to work on a chain gang for destroying parking meters. George Kennedy stars as the sadistic convict boss who tries to break Newman’s spirit by using an arsenal of punishments and torture such as ‘the box’; a windowless cubicle designed to drive an inmate insane. In one of his most memorable parts, Newman as Luke, will not allow himself to succumb to the arbitrary rules of captivity. Nevertheless, the audience is left with an impression of Luke as a victim to be pitied rather than scorned.

results.title: Continental divide
results.creator_credit: Universal Studios, Amblin Entertainment, Bob Larson and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: A romantic comedy starring John Belushi as a Chicago reporter who becomes a Mafia target following his series of articles exposing corruption. Hoping to alleviate the situation, his editor sends him on an assignment to a remote location in the Rocky Mountains to write a feature story on a reclusive researcher (Blair Brown) studying the endangered American bald eagle. Initially reluctant, she lets Belushi stay and despite radical differences their mutual attraction gradually draws them together. Cast also includes: Allen Goorwitz, Carlyn Glynn, Tony Ganios, Val Avery and Bill Henderson. Music composed and conducted by Michael Small. Editing, Dennis Virkler. Cinematography, John Bailey. Script, Lawrence Kasdan.
